race.name: Thunder Bay Thriller
race.tagline: Two-track and singletrack near Lake Huron's Thunder Bay in northern Michigan.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Michigan countryside. Moderate elevation with rolling scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Local Michigan event. Rolling terrain with remote access, low costs, and small local field.

biased_opinion.summary: Thunder Bay Thriller is a local event in Michigan—rolling terrain with moderate elevation. The Michigan countryside is nice and it's good value, but the small local field, remote location, and limited organization keep it in Tier 4.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid local Michigan gravel race. Worth it for Michigan/Midwest riders. Not worth traveling for.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're local to Michigan—yes, it's good value. If you're traveling—skip it.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Michigan races: Barry-Roubaix, Iceman Cometh.

logistics.food: Alpena has full dining options. Stock nutrition.

logistics.explanation: Thunder Bay Junior High School provides basic venue infrastructure with Harborside Cycle & Sport handling bike support. The "Chiller for the Thriller" pre-race dinner at Hopside Brewery includes full course breakdown, though no packet pickup or parking details are specified.

length.explanation: The 50-mile distance sits in standard gravel territory with 27-mile and 16-mile options available. Tracy Gravlin noted the final three miles "back to the finish" allowed her to "take off and felt great" after the technical sand sections eased up. More compact than Grinduro.

technicality.explanation: Tracy Gravlin faced "potholes to look out for and many deep sand areas" in the final 14 miles, plus "7 miles of that and then on to a single track that was even more deep sand!" She had to dismount four times and fell once through these sections. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: Tracy Gravlin described "some good climbing in the middle part of the course" through rolling terrain that reminded her of "Nebraska with the long roads and farm fields." The 2000ft gain provides modest but honest climbing for northern Michigan. Less climbing than The Mid South.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 79°F and lows of 60°F, with a 47% chance of rain on any given day. September race date in northern Michigan near Lake Huron means you're gambling on fall weather that could be perfect or miserable. No historical weather data provided, but you know the drill - potential for everything from crisp autumn perfection to cold rain and mud. The lake effect could work for or against you depending on wind direction and systems moving through. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego. As Race Day Conditions puts it: "Race day was beautiful! No wind. Great temps and sunshine."

altitude.explanation: Starting near Lake Huron at roughly 600 feet elevation means zero altitude considerations. Pure Great Lakes terrain where fitness is the only limiting factor, not thin air. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: Riding through Devils Lake two-track and Norway Ridge Pathway single-track offers backcountry Michigan exploration beyond just road grinding. The 'Sanctuary of the Great Lakes' setting near Lake Huron provides scenic backdrop for a solid gravel adventure. But it's still fundamentally Midwest terrain - pleasant and rideable, not the kind of epic landscape that defines destination races.

prestige.explanation: This is literally labeled a 'New Race' in the Michigan Gravel Race Series - you're not rolling up to Unbound here. No mention of pro riders, past winners, or YouTube coverage because there isn't any yet. It's a charity ride for cystic fibrosis that happens to time you, which is admirable but doesn't move needles in the gravel scene.

race_quality.explanation: The course delivers varied terrain from "fast rolling hero gravel" to "slightly rougher two-track" with strategic sand placement. Organizers "made an adjustment to the final few miles to minimize the amount of sand near the finish" based on rider feedback.

experience.explanation: You're getting a tour of northern Michigan's lakeside gravel near Lake Huron, which sounds pleasant enough for a weekend adventure. Thunder Bay Junior High as the venue and bike support from Harborside Cycle & Sport shows basic organization.

community.explanation: The 100% proceeds going to Rock CF Foundation gives this race actual heart beyond just another entry fee grab. They're promoting 'community spirit' and 'Michigan Gravel Grinder with Heart & Grit,' which sounds for a new local event. But community takes years to build - right now you're betting on potential, not proven camaraderie.

field_depth.explanation: New race, no field size data, no mention of competitive riders - this is strictly local curiosity territory. They have age groups from 11-14 up to 70+ and categories for singlespeed/fat bikes, which suggests they're casting a wide amateur net. Don't expect any meaningful competition beyond whoever shows up from the Alpena cycling scene. Thinner field than Ouray Gravel Grinder. As Tracy Gravlin puts it: "The gravel was fast and easy. There was some good climbing in the middle part of the course. There were several areas that reminded me of Nebraska with the long roads and farm fields with corn."

value.explanation: All proceeds fund cystic fibrosis research through Rock CF Foundation, giving entry fees direct charitable impact. The pre-race dinner costs $15 with full course breakdown, while diverse terrain and multiple distance options deliver solid racing value.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $50-75. Alpena offers affordable small-town lodging and dining near Lake Huron without resort pricing. The recommended minimum 38c tires work for the entire course on a standard gravel bike, though mountain bikes provide extra comfort in sand sections. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

videos.title: Thunder Bay Thriller - Gravel Race: Course Breakdown 2025
videos.description:
Welcome to the Thunder Bay Thriller - Gravel Race! Here we have Race Director, Trevor going through a long-form course breakdown of the 2025 edition.

Take on the challenge of the 62-mile multi-surface gravel grinder through the scenic Northeast Michigan countryside and trail system on September 14th, 2025. We are excited to announce that we will be part of the Michigan Gravel Race Series for the upcoming 2025 race calendar!

This fun and challenging route will take riders from rolling gravel backroads onto exciting snowmobile two-track against the picturesque Devils Lake, then weave through the woods of the Norway Ridge Pathway single/two-track system before cranking down the Alpena-Hillman Trail.

Want to ride but looking for something a bit shorter? We'll have the 27-mile option as well as the NEW 16-mile option to race day. The 27-mile course will still take you along all the fun of Indian Reserve Rd, Devil's Lake, and the Norway Ridge Pathway. 

62-Mile Route: https://www.strava.com/routes/3141032543975373186

27-Mile Route: https://www.strava.com/routes/3190142660854870178

16-Mile Route (ADJUSTED! As of 9/9/2025): https://www.strava.com/routes/3289323215895098208

Orange map for the 62, green map for the 27, blue map for the 16! This is will match with your bib color on race-day.

When: September 14th, 2025

Time: 62-Mile - 8:00am / 27-Mile - 8:05am / 16-Mile - 8:10am (may be subject to minor change based on weather)

Start/Finish - Where: Thunder Bay Jr High, Alpena, MI 49707

Awards: 62-Mile - Top 5 Men, Top 5 Women, Top Individual per age group, men/women: 11-14; 15-18; 19-29; 30-39; 40-49; 50-59; 60-69; 70 and over. Top nonbinary. Top SS and Fat bike.

27-Mile - Top 3 Men, Top 3 Women, Top Individual per age group, men/women: 11-14; 15-18; 19-29; 30-39; 40-49; 50-59; 60-69; 70 and over. Top nonbinary. Top SS and Fat bike.

16-Mile - Top 3 Men, Top 3 Women, Top Individual per age group, men/women: 11-14; 15-18; 19-29; 30-39; 40-49; 50-59; 60-69; 70 and over. Top nonbinary. Top SS and Fat bike.

New this year! We are adding the Clydesdale and Athena as well as Single Speed and Fat Bike category options. If you are unfamiliar with these and would like to know more, please email race director trevor@letsrockcf.org.

Packet Pickup:

Early Pickup - Saturday, September 13th from Harborside Cycle & Sport - 10:00am - 5:30pm

Race Day Pickup - Sunday, September 14th at Thunder Bay Junior High School - 6:00am - 8:00am (race time)

Each registrant will receive a shirt and sticker along with a swag bag from our sponsors!

We recommend a minimum of at least around 38c tires for this route, and the entire course can be done with a gravel bike. There will be some fast rolling hero gravel, slightly rougher two-track, and maybe a lil' bit of (dare I say it?) sand from time to time on the back trails! Just enough for a good time. If you would rather hop on the mountain bike for more comfort on the trails, totally doable and a nice option in a few sections. For those local to the area, stop by our Local Bike Shop Sponsor, Harborside Cycle & Sport of Alpena for your bike-check and tire needs.

This course will be marked, and marks/signage will be made clear in the rider's manual sent out closer to race date to all registrants. All participants are highly encouraged to download and save the Strava Route above to their GPS device to ensure route knowledge and safety. Riders are expected to follow the rules of the road based upon Michigan Bicycle Law.

Join us on Saturday, Sept. 13th at 5:30pm for the ‘Chiller for the Thriller’ pre-race dinner at Hopside Brewery in Downtown Alpena! We will be doing a full course breakdown to get you ready for race morning on Sunday. Hopside will be doing a pasta/carb-based meal. The event is free to attend, but cost of the dinner is $15 if you choose to eat. Dinner can be pre-paid with the add-on during registration on BikeReg or on-site!

The event is based out of Alpena, MI. Known as the Sanctuary of the Great Lakes, Alpena features plenty of opportunities and experiences for outdoor, culinary, and families against the beautiful, water-centric backdrop of Lake Huron. For ideas on things to do and lodging, check out Visit Alpena: https://www.visitalpena.com/

For those of you unable to attend, we will be hosting a virtual rider challenge on the same day as the race! Compete in a variety of challenges such as longest ride, most elevation gained, etc. More info on challenge details will be sent to virtual riders as we approach race date.

100% of all proceeds from the Thunder Bay Thriller go back towards the Rock CF Foundation: a nonprofit based out of Michigan dedicated to heightening awareness for cystic fibrosis and providing those living with CF the tools to not only survive, but thrive. Learn more about Rock CF here: https://letsrockcf.org/

videos.title: Rock CF's Thunder Bay Thriller - Full Course Walk-Through
videos.description:
Welcome to the THUNDER BAY THRILLER!

Take on the challenge of a brand new 62-mile multi-surface gravel grinder through the scenic Northeast Michigan countryside and trail system on June 1st, 2024.

This fun and challenging route will take riders from rolling gravel backroads onto exciting snowmobile two-track against the picturesque Devils Lake, then weave through the woods of the Norway Ridge Pathway single/two-track system before cranking down the Alpena-Hillman Trail.

Want to ride but looking for something a bit shorter? We've got you covered! We're excited to announce the addition of the 27-mile Short Course option to race day. The 27-mile course will still take you along all the fun of Indian Reserve Rd, Devil's Lake, and the Norway Ridge Pathway.

62-Mile Route: https://www.strava.com/routes/3141032543975373186

27-Mile Route: https://www.strava.com/routes/3190142660854870178

Orange map for the 62, green map for the 27. This is will match with your bib color on race-day.

When: June 1st, 2024

Time: 62-Mile - 8:00am / 27-Mile - 8:05am (may be subject to minor change based on weather)

Start/Finish - Where: Thunder Bay Jr High, Alpena, MI 49707

Awards: 62-Mile - Top 5 Men, Top 5 Women, Top Individual per age group, men/women: 11-14; 15-18; 19-29; 30-39; 40-49; 50-59; 60-69; 70 and over. Top nonbinary.

27-Mile - Top 3 Men, Top 3 Women, Top Individual per age group, men/women: 11-14; 15-18; 19-29; 30-39; 40-49; 50-59; 60-69; 70 and over. Top nonbinary.

Packet Pickup:

Early Pickup - Friday, May 31st from Harborside Cycle & Sport - 10:00am - 5:30pm

Race Day Pickup - June 1st 2024 at Thunder Bay Junior High School - 6:00am - 8:00am (race time)

Each registrant will receive a shirt and sticker along with Squirt Chain Lube packet in their race bag! 

We recommend a minimum of at least around 38c tires for this route, and the entire course can be done with a gravel bike. There will be some fast rolling hero gravel, slightly rougher two-track, and maybe a lil' bit of (dare I say it?) sand from time to time on the back trails! Just enough for a good time. If you would rather hop on the mountain bike for more comfort on the trails, totally doable and a nice option in a few sections. For those local to the area, stop by our Local Bike Shop Sponsor, Harborside Cycle & Sport of Alpena for your bike-check and tire needs.

This course will be marked, and marks/signage will be made clear in the rider's manual sent out closer to race date to all registrants. All participants are highly encouraged to download and save the Strava Route above to their GPS device to ensure route knowledge and safety. Riders are expected to follow the rules of the road based upon Michigan Bicycle Law.

Thunder Bay Catering of Alpena will be providing the post-race lunch for all race participants! Once you conquer the course, enjoy a delicious protein bowl filled with an array of build-your-own-style toppings. After things wind down on course, join us for some great craft beer, spirits, and delicious bites at our official After Party Sponsor location, Hopside Brewery! Hopside is perfectly situated right in the heart of downtown Alpena and within walking distance to many of the city’s entertainment options.

The event is based out of Alpena, MI. Known as the Sanctuary of the Great Lakes, Alpena features plenty of opportunities and experiences for outdoor, culinary, and families against the beautiful, water-centric backdrop of Lake Huron. For ideas on things to do and lodging, check out Visit Alpena: https://www.visitalpena.com/

For those of you unable to attend, we will be hosting a virtual rider challenge on the same day as the race! Compete in a variety of challenges such as longest ride, most elevation gained, etc. More info on challenge details will be sent to virtual riders as we approach race date.

100% of all proceeds from the Thunder Bay Thriller go back towards the Rock CF Foundation: a nonprofit based out of Michigan dedicated to heightening awareness for cystic fibrosis and providing those living with CF the tools to not only survive, but thrive. Learn more about Rock CF here: https://letsrockcf.org/

All participants will receive a Thunder Bay Thriller Race Shirt, pictured here! Pretty sweet, right?

Thank you to our incredible sponsors: Vertex, Viatris, Squirt Cycling Products, Harborside Cycle & Sport, STS Bicycles, and Hopside Brewery of Alpena.

rider_intel.search_text: The Thunder Bay Thriller in Alpena, Michigan features surprisingly varied terrain that goes beyond typical gravel racing. Riders describe the course as having much more diversity than expected, with two-track sections that feel like obstacle courses with more challenges than anticipated. The race offers 62-mile, 27-mile, and 16-mile distance options, with the longer course adding a southern loop near Hubbard Lake. Parking opens at 6 a.m. at Thunder Bay Junior High School via Third Avenue, with early arrival recommended for closer spots to the start/finish line. Volunteers are stationed at busier intersections for rider safety. The race attracts around 170 participants and features strong community support, with riders helping each other on course when mechanical issues arise. The event benefits the Rock CF Foundation, a cystic fibrosis nonprofit, with 100% of proceeds supporting patient programs.
